conclusion: Determine the magnitude and direction of the resultant Ampere force acting on the trapezoidal frame.
The trapezoid has sides AB and CD forming an angle of 60° with side AD, and ab = bc = cd = L.
The resistivity of the wire is ρ and the cross-sectional area is S.
The projection of AB and CD on AD is L cos 60° = L/2.
The vertical component of AB and CD is L sin 60° = (√3)L/2.
The total length of AD is 2L.
The length of AB and CD is L sec 60° = 2L each.
The total length of the wire is 6L.
The resistance per unit length of the wire is ρ/S.
The current I in the circuit is ES/(6ρL).
The force on AB and CD is F = BIL.
The force on BC and DA is F = BIL sin 30° = (1/2) BIL.
The force on AB and CD is BES/(3ρ).
The force on BC and DA is BES/(12ρ).
The forces on AB and CD cancel each other out.
The magnitude of the resultant Ampere force is BES/(6ρ) and the direction is horizontal to the right.
